content:
Check:
  all:
    - name: IDVAR
      operator: non_empty
    - name: CODTC
      operator: non_empty
Core:
  Id: CORE-000187
  Version: '1'
  Status: Published
Description: Trigger error when IDVAR is not null and CODTC is not null
Outcome:
  Message: CODTC is populated when IDVAR is also populated
  Output Variables:
    - USUBJID
    - IDVAR
    - CODTC
Rule Type: Record Data
Sensitivity: Record
Authorities:
  - Organization: CDISC
    Standards:
      - Name: SDTMIG
        Version: '3.4'
        References:
          - Origin: SDTM and SDTMIG Conformance Rules
            Rule Identifier:
              Id: CG0168
              Version: '1'
            Version: '2.0'
            Citations:
              - Cited Guidance: Date/time of comment on dedicated comment form. Should
                  be null if this is a child record of another domain or if comment
                  date was not collected.
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: Specification
                Section: '5.1'
              - Cited Guidance: Those related to a specific parent record or group
                  of parent records, in which case the value of the variable RDOMAIN
                  is set to the DOMAIN code of the parent record(s) and the variables
                  IDVAR and IDVARVAL are populated with the key variable name and
                  value of the parent record(s). Assumptions for populating IDVAR
                  and IDVARVAL are further described in Section 8.5, Relating Comments
                  to a Parent Domain. CODTC should be null because the timing of the
                  parent record(s) is inherited by the comment record. See example,
                  Rows 3-5.
                Document: IG v3.4
                Item: Assumption 2c
                Section: '5.1'
Scope:
  Classes:
    Include:
      - SPECIAL-PURPOSE
  Domains:
    Include:
      - CO

json.Description: Trigger error when IDVAR is not null and CODTC is not null

Outcome.Message: CODTC is populated when IDVAR is also populated

Citations.Cited_Guidance: Date/time of comment on dedicated comment form. Should be null if this is a child record of another domain or if comment date was not collected.

Those related to a specific parent record or group of parent records, in which case the value of the variable RDOMAIN is set to the DOMAIN code of the parent record(s) and the variables IDVAR and IDVARVAL are populated with the key variable name and value of the parent record(s). Assumptions for populating IDVAR and IDVARVAL are further described in Section 8.5, Relating Comments to a Parent Domain. CODTC should be null because the timing of the parent record(s) is inherited by the comment record. See example, Rows 3-5.
